Package jrtr

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrtr.Camera
  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores the specification of a virtual camera. You will extend this class to construct a 4x4 camera matrix, i.e., the world-to- camera transform from intuitive parameters. A scene manager (see SceneManagerInterface, SimpleSceneManager) stores a camera.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera()
        Construct a camera with a default camera matrix. The camera matrix corresponds to the world-to-camera transform. This default matrix places the camera at (0,0,10) in world space, facing towards the origin (0,0,0) of world space, i.e., towards the negative z-axis.

    • Method Detail

      • getCameraMatrix

        public javax.vecmath.Matrix4f getCameraMatrix()
        Return the camera matrix, i.e., the world-to-camera transform. For example, this is used by the renderer.
        Returns:
        the 4x4 world-to-camera transform matrix

      • setCameraMatrix

        public void setCameraMatrix​(javax.vecmath.Matrix4f m)
        Set the camera matrix, i.e., the world-to-camera transform.
